abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Quality
            Education in the Rural Areas of Moldova Project is to
            increase the quality of education in rural areas in Moldova.
            This restructuring paper extends the closing date of the
            Project from May 30, 2012 until October 31, 2012.  This will
            be the Project's second extension for a cumulative
            period of 29 months. In line with its Project Development
            Objective (PDO), the Project has continuously contributed to
            improving the quality of education in the rural areas of
            Moldova.  Since its approval, the Project has steadily moved
            toward achieving its PDO which has, throughout its lifetime,
            oscillated between the ratings of moderately satisfactory
            and satisfactory.  The latter has been the rating for the
            past twelve months.  The PDO is measured through the
            improvements in average learning in rural schools and the
            reduction in the gap in achievements between rural and urban
            schools.  The Project has, moreover, served as a catalyst in
            jumpstarting education efficiency reform measures outlined
            in the Government's Education Reform Program. This
            five-month extension is being sought in order to avoid a
            financing gap for the Project as the Additional Financing
            (AF) of the Project, which was approved by the Board on
            March 20, 2012, is not expected to be effective before the
            current closing date of May 30, 2012.  The AF will be
            effective once it is ratified by the Parliament of Moldova
            which could take up to five months.  The original Project
            was financed through a Grant and a Credit in the amounts of
            SDR 3.6 million each (US$5 million equivalent, for a total
            of US$10 million equivalent) to be implemented over a
            four-year period.  The Project was approved on February 14,
            2006, and became effective on August 7, 2006.
